meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the sky snawed all day long.
meanings.sent2: Last winter, the snow snawed gently on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The snow snawed so much that we built a giant snowman!
meanings.sent4: The snow snawed like a soft blanket covering the earth.
meanings.sent5: I remember the day when the snow snawed heavily, creating a winter wonderland.

meanings.sent1: The mountain peak looked snawed under the white snow.
meanings.sent2: The snawed trees sparkled in the sunlight after the snowfall.
meanings.sent3: The snawed landscape was a sight to behold, like a scene from a postcard.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was snawed with snowflakes, making her look like a winter princess.
meanings.sent5: The snawed rooftops of the houses created a picturesque winter scene.

meanings.definition: Damaged or worn down by snow.
meanings.sent1: The snawed roof of the old barn collapsed under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent2: The snawed fence showed signs of wear and tear from the harsh winter.
meanings.sent3: The snawed car struggled to start in the cold snowy morning.
meanings.sent4: Her snawed boots had seen better days, with holes from walking in the snow.
meanings.sent5: The snawed path was slippery and dangerous, showing the effects of the snowstorm.
